required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mobile Subthreshold Exercise Program for Concussion
clinical_study.official_title: Mobile Subthreshold Exercise Program (M-STEP) for Concussion

brief_summary.textblock: Non-randomized pilot intervention using mobile-administered sub-threshold exercise to treat youth with prolonged symptoms of concussion.

detailed_description.textblock: 6-week pilot study of a novel intervention for concussion, administering a sub-threshold exercise program in a mobile fashion using video conferencing and providing feedback using wrist-worn accelerometry and heart rate monitoring.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All youth will receive the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire regarding Health-related quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fear of pain questionnaire (FOPQ)-P/C, adapted for concussion
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire completed by parent and child regarding their fear of concussive symptoms and avoidance of activities that might produce concussive symptoms
Self-report questionnaire of positive mood levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in moderate to vigorous physical activity (MVPA)
secondary_outcome.description: Average minutes per day of MVPA, measured using hip-mounted accelerometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Adolescent Sleep Wake Scale (ASWS)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report 10-item questionnaire regarding difficulty falling asleep, night wakenings and other sleep issues
Self-report questionnaire regarding sporting and recreational activities that a youth participated in that week
Self-report questionnaire (completed by parents) regarding their approach to physical activity with their child.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Adult responses to child's symptoms (ARCS), adapted for concussion
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire regarding parenting responses to child's concussive symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Generalized anxiety disorder--7 item (GAD7)

intervention.description: Youth will be assessed using actigraphy at baseline, and will then be asked to exercise for 1) a duration of 10 minutes > MVPA at baseline with 2) HR>120 while being monitored by a Fitbit. Youth will be asked to exercise daily, and intensity and duration will be increased every few days for a goal of 60 minutes per day at a HR>140 (low end of MVPA). The intervention will be 6 weeks in duration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Concussion diagnosed by a healthcare provider that occurred 2 weeks-6 months ago
- Continued symptoms with at least 3 symptoms on the HBI and a score of 20+
- No other issues that would preclude physical activity
- Parents and youth are English-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Already participating in >30 minutes of MVPA/day
